feed.title: RustSec Advisories
feed.subtitle: Security advisories filed against Rust crates

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2023-0094: martin-mbtiles is unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2023-0094

martin-mbtiles has been renamed to mbtiles
Reported
October 30, 2023
Issued
September 14, 2025
Package
martin-mbtiles (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://github.com/maplibre/martin/commit/8a8814e7cc97d44f4d194586b3e9deb904c99488
Patched
no patched versions

Description

Please use the mbtiles crate going forward.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0067: Unsoundness in libyml
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0067

libyml::string::yaml_string_extend is unsound and unmaintained
Reported
September 11, 2025
Issued
September 12, 2025
Package
libyml (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
References
  • https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/issues/2395
Patched
no patched versions

Description

In version 0.0.4, libyml::string::yaml_string_extend was revised resulting in undefined behaviour, which is unsound.

The GitHub project for libyml was archived after unsoundness issues were raised.

If you rely on this crate, it is highly recommended switching to a maintained alternative.

Recommended alternatives

  • libyaml-safer
  • unsafe-libyaml-norway - Maintained fork of unsafe-libyaml

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0068: Unsoundness in serde_yml
entry.summary: serde_yml crate is unsound and unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0068

serde_yml crate is unsound and unmaintained
Reported
September 11, 2025
Issued
September 12, 2025
Package
serde_yml (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
References
  • https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/issues/2395
Patched
no patched versions

Description

Using serde_yml::ser::Serializer.emitter can cause a segmentation fault, which is unsound.

The GitHub project for serde_yml was archived after unsoundness issues were raised.

If you rely on this crate, it is highly recommended switching to a maintained alternative.

Recommended alternatives

  • serde_norway - Maintained fork of serde_yaml, using unsafe-libyaml-norway
  • serde_yaml_ng - Maintained fork of serde_yaml, using unmaintained unsafe-libyaml

Incomplete pure Rust alternatives

These implementation do not rely on C libyaml.

  • serde_yaml2
  • yaml-peg

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2021-0154: Unsoundness in fuser
entry.summary: Uninitalized memory read & leak caused by fuser crate
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2021-0154

Uninitalized memory read & leak caused by fuser crate
Reported
September 10, 2021
Issued
September 12, 2025
Package
fuser (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
Categories
  • code-execution
Keywords
#fuse
References
  • https://github.com/cberner/fuser/pull/390
  • https://github.com/libfuse/libfuse/pull/1330
Patched
  • >=1.2.0
Affected Functions
Version
fuser::Session::new
  • >=0.5.0

Description

During creation of new libfuse session with fuse_session_new operation list was passed as NULL incorrectly. libfuse expects this argument to always point to list of operations. This caused uninitialized memory read and leaks in libfuse.so

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0065: Vulnerability in matrix-sdk-base
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0065

matrix-sdk-base: Panic in the RoomMember::normalized_power_level() method
Reported
September 11, 2025
Issued
September 11, 2025
Package
matrix-sdk-base (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Aliases
  • CVE-2025-59047
  • GHSA-qhj8-q5r6-8q6j
References
  • https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-rust-sdk/security/advisories/GHSA-qhj8-q5r6-8q6j
Patched
  • >=0.14.1
Affected Functions
Version
matrix_sdk_base::RoomMember::normalized_power_level
  • <=0.14.0

Description

In matrix-sdk-base before 0.14.1, calling the RoomMember::normalized_power_level() method can cause a panic if a room member has a power level of Int::Min.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0064: Unsoundness in wren_rust
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0064

soundness issue and unmaintained
Reported
May 6, 2025
Issued
September 11, 2025
Package
wren_rust (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
Categories
  • memory-corruption
References
  • https://docs.rs/wren_rust
Patched
no patched versions
Affected Functions
Version
wren_rust::macros::_default_realloc
  • <=0.1.3

Description

wren_rust::macros::_default_realloc() lacks sufficient checks to it pointer parameter which passed into free and realloc

wren_rust is unmaintained.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0063: Vulnerability in fast-able
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0063

Possible unsound public API
Reported
April 25, 2025
Issued
September 11, 2025
Package
fast-able (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • memory-corruption
Patched
  • >=1.13.7
Affected Functions
Version
fast_able::vec::SyncVec::get_unchecked
  • <1.13.7

Description

The public accessible struct SyncVec has a public safe method get_unchecked. It accept a parameter index and used in the get_unchecked without sufficient checks as mentioned here.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0062: Vulnerability in toodee
entry.summary: Heap Buffer Overflow in the DrainCol Destructor
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0062

Heap Buffer Overflow in the DrainCol Destructor
Reported
May 22, 2025
Issued
September 8, 2025
Package
toodee (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • memory-corruption
  • memory-exposure
Keywords
#memory-safety #buffer-overflow
References
  • https://github.com/antonmarsden/toodee/issues/26
Patched
  • >=0.6.0
Unaffected
  • <0.2.0
Affected Functions
Version
toodee::DrainCol::drop
  • >=0.2.0, <=0.5.0

Description

An off-by-one error in the DrainCol::drop destructor could cause an unsafe memory copy operation to exceed the bounds of the associated vector.

The error was related to the size of the data being copied in one of the ptr::copy invocations inside the destructor.

When removing the first column from a TooDee object, the DrainCol return object could cause a heap buffer overflow vulnerability when it is dropped.

The issue was fixed in commit e6e16d5 by reducing the copied size by one.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.
